intro: Gravesia oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gravesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, with opposite, elliptic to oblong leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine and are also appreciated for their ornamental value in horticulture.
